pre_caption: This video presents an extreme wide scenery shot, capturing a vast landscape under a massive storm. The storm cloud system dominates the upper two-thirds of the frame, positioned in the middle ground and background. Its darkest, most defined shelf-like structure stretches from the center to the left, while lighter, higher clouds fill the top and right portions of the frame. Curtains of precipitation are visible falling in the center and left middle ground, connecting the cloud base to the land. The bottom third of the frame is occupied by a flat prairie in the foreground and middle ground, with the horizon line situated low. The camera is positioned at a low angle, looking up, which emphasizes the scale of the storm. In the time-lapse, the clouds churn and billow, with the entire formation showing dynamic internal movement as it progresses across the scene.
